intro: Thlaspi idahoense, commonly known as Idaho pennycress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in areas with full sun. It produces small, yellow flowers and has compound leaves with a distinctive lobed shape. Thlaspi idahoense is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and thrive in harsh environments.
